content: back loop only if previous row chain 1 and turn row 17 chain 1 additional stitch to create a chain 2 1dc into the same stitch creating 2 stitches to start the row skip 2 stitches and 3dc in the 3rd stitch repeat skipping 2 stitches and 3dc in 3rd stitch through the remainder of the row creating 87 bunches of 3dc end the row with one double_crochet at the last stitch chain 2 and turn row 18 1dc into same stitch as the chain 2 decrease double_crochet into each of 3 double_crochet of previous row just like row 8 of main structure of the shawl row 19 repeat row 9 of the main body of the shawl row 20 1sc into each stitch of row 19 to get 30 stitches across leave a lengthy tail to sew the pocket onto the shawl around 3 sides of the pocket i kept 40 inches in order to have some left over the weave in before cutting to sew on pockets i used the mattress stitch and placed pockets along seam after row 11 of shawl and chose the following for different heights of people small pocket placed 4 bunches from bottom of shawl length medium pocket placed 3 bunches from bottom of shawl length large pocket placed 2 bunches from bottom of shawl length place 2nd pocket the same distance from the first row of the shawl and the same amount of bunches from the end tassels cut 6 pieces of yarn at 12 inches long each for each tassel you may have 16 tassels total on each end of the shawl equals 192 strands to get 2 sets of 16 tassels total use a larger hook size i used size 10 mm to grab all 6 strands of the tassel from the back side of the shawl pulling through from the front loop around from the back to the front and pull the ends of the strings through to show the wrap around loop at the top of the tassel nicely taut for placement i used the space between the front facing half_double_crochet at the ends of the shawl one more space to total 2 tassels in the ribbed half_double_crochet area of the ends of the shawl the remaining tassels fill in every other of the 3 double_crochet bunches across the end of the shawl looping through the chain 2 and 1dc that began each row of the shawl
